name: Kentucky Women's Cancer Screening Program
description: The Kentucky Women's Cancer Screening Program (KWCSP) is a federally funded public health program providing free breast and cervical cancer screening and diagnostic services to eligible women in Kentucky. Services include mammograms, Pap tests, and diagnostic follow-up care. The program is administered through local health departments and participating clinics across the state.
source: Verified from official Kentucky Cabinet for Health and Family Services website and multiple resource directories
hours_of_operation: Varies by provider location - call for specific hours
eligibility_requirements: Women ages 21+, household income at or below 250% federal poverty level, no health insurance (including Medicaid and Medicare Part B)
populations_served: Eligible women in Kentucky seeking cancer screening services
cost_information: Free screening services for eligible women
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2025-01-27.
